 There is only one answer. If you are human, you are of the human race. The other variations that some people call 'race' are not meaningful in a biological sense. Because of the genetic bottleneck that appears to have happened 75,000 to 80,000 years ago, there is not enough variation in the homosapien species to have 'races' yet.
 
 The races could be called 'ethnic groups'.. but such minor variations as pigmentation and minor bone structure and features are not large enough to seperate them into 'race'.
